sub_head: Improving a credit score and using discount points can help buyers obtain a better deal, even as interest rates are expected to rise
body:
Interest rates on mortgages are expected to rise as the Federal Reserve is on track to tighten monetary policy this year. Yet for now, rates are staying low.
The average rate for a 30-year fixed-rate loan is 3.89%, mortgage-finance giant Freddie Mac said Feb. 24, down slightly from 3.92% the prior week, with the figures staying near historic lows.
